result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:39 AM Defendant Colette A. Mahan in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Colette A. Mahan. 
Defense is waiting for a pretrial offer.
Defense is watching the federal case to see how it tracks.
Defendant to appear by video for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter from Defendant's Fiance' asking for permission to appear via zoom for next hearing.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on October 6, 2022 - APPROVED.**
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:40 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Colette A. Mahan in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Kenosha County Detention Center, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Sonderhouse provides an update, he has discovery but is waiting on an offer.  Atty. Sonderhouse is requesting a further proceedings date in October.  Atty. Nickolie will make sure the ADA assigned to the case puts together an offer and forwards to defense.  Court adjourns for further proceedings in early October.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
